title: Foreign Land And Sky
opening: The war in Fódlan has put Brigid in a precarious position. With Bernadetta in tow, Petra returns to her homeland in hopes of avoiding a confrontation with her grandfather.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Ah, nothing like a moment of perfect stillness...

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: Why is it preferable to have stillness?

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Ah! Petra? Please don't sneak up on me like that! Oh... You're here too, Professor? What's going on?

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: I was asking my question first. What are you enjoying about air that is still?

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Um. Still air makes me feel better, that's all. It means you're in a nice, closed-off space where you can hide.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: But spaces that are wide and open are wonderful. Places like forests and oceans.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Guess we'll have to agree to disagree about that.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: I am not understanding your answer, but I am appreciating your explanation. I am reminded. I was wanting to ask if you wish to go to the forest or ocean with me?

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Um. What? What part of anything I said would make you think I wanted that?

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: So your grandfather is in trouble. He's trying to lend us soldiers from Brigid, but... Edelgard is sending messengers there to convince Brigid she's not their enemy.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: You are saying messengers, but the truth is they are a threat. Brigid is having no power to refuse.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: I get it, but what does this have to do with me?

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: Professor was asking this of me. I was told...if I am going to a far away place, to be taking Bernie with me, since she is hiding away.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: What?! Professor! What did I do to deserve this?! I know I'm a recluse, but I do go out on missions once in a while!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: You can't refuse.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Tyranny! Abuse of power! I have rights!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Lend me your strength.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: You say that, but I don't think I'm ready for this.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: Bernie, I am wanting this as well. Please join me.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Since you put it that way, Petra...I'll think about it. Do you really want me to go, Professor?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I do.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: All right. I'll lend a hand...for everyone's sake!

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: What is the point of lending a hand? Are you not needing both of them to battle?

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: What?! No, it's a figure of speech! Oh, don't make me imagine that!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm not sure.

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: Maybe we are not needing you then. I will try borrowing the power of the church.

intro.speaker: Bernadetta
intro.line: Um, OK... I don't mind shutting myself in like usual. But I can't say I feel good about all this!

intro.speaker: Petra
intro.line: If your mind is changing, please tell me. I will be waiting as long as I can.

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: My life is endangered! I must keep alive!

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: Reinforcements are ready. Let us attack with each other!

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: Professor... Please, convey to my grandfather... that... I am without regret...

battle.speaker: Bernadetta
battle.line: Petra!? Petra no! Don't leave us!

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: Grandfather, I cannot be meeting you... My objective was failed.

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: Brigid is a vassal of the Empire. You will not turn them against us!

boss.speaker: Catherine
boss.line: Brigid will not become a puppet of the Empire. The Knights of Seiros won't let it happen!

boss.speaker: Catherine
boss.line: I can't achieve anything more here. Keep fighting! Stop them!

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: So, Princess of Brigid. Now we see where your loyalties truly lie. This, after we spared your life in return for naught but your fealty. How ungrateful.

boss.speaker: Petra
boss.line: Ten years have been passed. The Empire has been changed, just as Brigid has!

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: Heheheh. Go on and scream, if it makes you feel better. But if you could die swiftly and without a struggle, I would greatly appreciate it.

boss.speaker: Bernadetta
boss.line: Ah! It's Thunder Catherine! We're done for!

boss.speaker: Catherine
boss.line: Hey, I was going to say that! You didn't let me introduce myself. How rude. Thunderbrand and I will have to teach you some manners.

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: It is done. Now, I can be meeting my grandfather. We must be moving with haste!

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: Finally over? Phew! All right, let's get out of here! This isn't exactly, um, the ideal environment for a recluse, you know.

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: I will be speaking with my grandfather. Once he is convinced, I will be returning. Professor, everyone, please be waiting here. Enemies may still be nearby.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: Got it. We'll wait right here. And if anyone comes, um, the professor will handle it! Right, Professor?

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: The vegetation around here's pretty different from the kinds we usually see. It may be no good for a recluse, but the forest does have its own charms, doesn't it?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm surprised to hear you say that.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: Didn't you know? I love greenery! Especially carnivorous plants. They're my favorite.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: You like plants?

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: Sure do! Especially the carnivorous ones.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Carnivorous plants...

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: Yes! They just sit there, nice and still, and wait for their dinner to come to them! How great is that? And they all look so unique too!

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: What? Don't you think so? Oh, look! Petra's back!

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: Sorry to be making you wait. I have spoken with him.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: It's been a long time since you've seen your grandfather, huh? How'd it go?

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: As is usual, my grandfather is well and strong. He was saying that he will be supporting us and giving us troops.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: That's great! So we did it?

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: We did. You have my thanks. Ever since we were losing the war to the Empire, Brigid has been viewed as a vassal state. But with Fódlan at war...it is a chance for Brigid to be changing our situation. Our cooperation today is part of that chance. Brigid is wanting equality with Fódlan. We will be working hard to make this happen.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: Ah...

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: Bernie? What is it you are feeling?

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: You're amazing, Petra. You went all by yourself to a foreign country... You worked hard for your homeland, and you achieved your goal. I'm always focused on my own problems, and I barely ever get anywhere...

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: That is not the truth. You were fighting hard for me. You came here to be helping everyone. You were not thinking only of yourself. I am never doubting you were working hard. We will be working together to keep moving forward to the future.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: You...really mean it? That's so nice!

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: And you were telling me about your interest in foreign vegetation. That is one reason I wanted to be bringing you here. Did it make you happy?

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: It did! It was really exciting! I've got so many drawings I need to do before we head back! I might even have enough to make it into a book! Yeah, I should do that! Want to help, Professor?
